name: Lighthouse Inn

reviews.title: Great Time
reviews.text: The Lighthouse INN is a great place to take the family. We just stayed there for 6 nights and we had a wonderful time. They have a nice pool, nice main lodge with a restaurant overlooking the beach.

I will admit that the rooms are not amazing and the food is not that great but it is a great place to take children and the view, location just can't be beat. The hotel beach is not that great, but the town beach next store is fine.
reviews.title: Nice but probably wont return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have traveled a lot and I definitely would come back again.
reviews.title: Did not live up to Expectations

reviews.text: My husband and i stayed here in late June 2010, just before busy 4rh July weekend to avail of lower peak rate, stayed in a cottage (studio) just behind the main house. Great location on beach, food was good, and the a/c was great because weather just became hot. I was not impressed with the number of bugs in the room, YUCK! When i mentioned it to the desk they has someone come spray but i think they knew they had an infestation amd rented the room anyway. We put our bags on tables and hung up smaller bags so that bugs wouldnt get in them.
reviews.title: Relaxing beach vacation!

reviews.text: I liked the Lighthouse Inn wirh its pretty location, good food. I think the rooms could do with some updating for the price, and was not impressed with paying full price for a bug infested cottage (they did not offer anything for our troubles). I will try other hotels or cottages on the Cape next time. Would recommend it but with huge caveat about bugs and customer service.
reviews.title: Would never go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live a mile and a half away, and have been in the restaurant before. The hotel part of it looks great, it is right on the water, has a working lighthouse within it, has beaches adjacent to it as well as its own waterfront area. I would hardly recommend it. If we did not live so close, we would be guests there, but somehow it would not be a getaway for us when our drive home would be less than five minutes. But highly recommended by us.
reviews.title: Never Stayed there- --BUT.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went during the labor day weekend and the weather was perfect. We stayed in the guest house and had a room facing the sea. The room was great, had 2 double beds. Breakfast was very good. The staff is very friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are lots of things to do here, especially if you are staying with kids, there's a small playground with lots of swings. The heated pool is very good. They also have volleyball, tennis and kayaking and jet skis.
reviews.title: Not even there yet.....

reviews.text: Skip the dinner though, its expensive and not very good (lobster was good though).
reviews.title: Magicial Weekend Wedding location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had Bathroom Flies but that was probably because we kept the windows open to get the breeze from the ocean and the amazing ocean wave sound.
reviews.title: The Lighthouse Inn is one of the best seaside retreats in America.

reviews.text: I had not been to the Inn in about 15 years and was excited to try it after all this time for dinner, what a disappointment! I ordered baked scrod with ritz cracker crumbs. It was so dry and the fish tasted old. My two friends ordered salmon and the other surf and turf. The steak was ordered medium rare and came very well done and very grey! My friend took one bite and could not eat it. The waitress came to the table and we also informed her that all three of our baked potatoes were cold and the butter would not even melt on it. The veggies were stone cold too. She told us that she would bring three more potatoes when she returned with a new steak, those too were stone cold. I would think that someone would be sure to zap the potatoes in the micro wave if someone had complained about cold food! The manager came over and told us that he was very sorry and would take the meals off the bill. He also offered us drinks or dessert. He was nice but we were so disappointed on what was suppose to be a nice fresh seafood dinner. I would not go back again.
reviews.title: How can you blow a baked potato?

reviews.text: We visit the Cape annually and are always looking for new restaurants that we haven't tried so this is based on the RESTAURANT ONLY. My DH and I went to the restaurant for dinner with my two young boys. I have NEVER been more disappointed with a restaurant in my life! And it ended up costing us close to $100 dollars.
reviews.title: ATE AT THE RESTAURANT....ugh!!!

reviews.text: We ordered chix nuggets and pizza for my sons. The pizza was covered in shredded yellow cheese (chedder) and was cold. He is a pizza fan but he wouldn't touch this. My dinner was AWFUL! It was a penne with seafood...it was also covered by the shredded yellow cheese. I was nervous to eat the seafood with the amount of attention our meals had been given. My DH had a scallop dish and he agreed that it was an awful meal. All of that said and done, with two glasses of wine...the meal was about $90. The one positive was the views. We had a great night with a slight breeze and terrific views.
reviews.title: We are coming back

reviews.text: We booked this for labor weekend, so we didnt have to travel around and could take bikes etc. We were due to arrive on the Friday night, but so was the hurricane! We emailed the hotel and asked for suggestions, we agreed not to go on Friday, just in case and went Saturday morning, we arrived on Saturday around 10 was allowed to check in and went off exploring....
reviews.title: Very nice hotel right on the water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing on the beach, breakfast included to please every taste, close to local Cape attractions and restaurants. My 11 year old wants it to be a family tradition to go every labor weekend....... Guess we better book soon then!
reviews.title: Not worth the money. Good location but overpriced.

reviews.text: Such a great hotel! The location can NOT be beat and the hospitality makes you feel like you are visiting friends. Anywhere you look you get a water view - from dining al fresco on the porch, or inside in the restaurant, or sitting by the pool, and even from your bedroom.
reviews.title: A True Cape Cod experence - Family friendly and Fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Stone family are so accomodating, especially for a large family group like ours, there wasn't anything we needed. Shuffleboard, mini-golf, wave runners and a fire pit for smores - plenty to keep the kids occupied. and the adults just loved the lobster and grilled steaks for dinner, not to mention all the delicious desserts, and breakfast was unbelievable. It never ended and was scrumptious.
reviews.title: Excellant

reviews.text: I truly recommend this place if you want to experience a relaxing get away with a true Cape Cod touch. Actually I have recommended it and my friends enjoyed it as well.
reviews.title: A huge disappointment....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are looking forward to returning again and again and have already booked 2011!
reviews.title: How Relaxing

reviews.text: I was scepticle in booking an accommodation based on some of the other reviews, but t took a chance because some people are just out to find the negatives regarless, so i booked and room in the Breezeway building. It was a good price compared to some of the cottages, and still had a slight view of the water and a fireplace with wood provided which was nice on a chilly evening. The front desk staff were so friendly and excited to welcome us when we checked in, and although we got there a few hours before 3pm checkin time, they offered to check with housekeeping to confirm if the room was available earlier for checkin, it was so they proceeded to check us in and ask if we needed assitance with our bags, there was no need however because we were able to park right in front of the accommodations. we were close to the pool although we didnt use it because there was so much else to do on the property..we played shuffleboard, tennis (racquets and balls were available at front desk at no additional charge) we sat outside on the restaurant deck and enjoyed the ocean breeze, although dinner wasnt being served yet til late June the front desk staff gave some excellant suggestions for restaurants and activities in the area. we slept well that evening, the following day there were two seperate weddings one during the afternoon and one in the evening, we stood outside to catch a glimpse of the brides and their guests and everyone seemed to have a lovely time, Its a beautiful place for a wedding, which is probably why they seem to have so many (i think they said 5 a weekend during may, june, september, oct) we had breakfast included every morning which was so much i could barely contain myself, they also had a menu if you didnt want anything on the hot and cold buffet. My husband and i had a great time and will definitly be back, although its not a 4 star RESORT, it is just as it is advertised to be it's OLD CAPE COD at its finest, people who read these reviews need to realize what that means, it is not luxury it is down to earth, comfortable, back in the day FAMILY place. where u feel like your home and can let loose and relax like u are.
reviews.title: Lighthouse Inn does it right

description: Lighthouse Inn-A True Oceanfront Cape Cod Classic.. The historic oceanfront Lighthouse Inn is home to the only privately owned and privately operated US Coast Guard-sanctioned lighthouse. Variety of accommodations, Cape Cod-style houses with private guestrooms and bathrooms, quaint cottages or traditional hotel style guestrooms. We offer bed and breakfast rates or American plan rates, which includes breakfast and dinner. Open mid-May through Columbus Day. Special packages are also available.
